definition[0]: to take the place or position of something or someone
example[0]: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
example[1]: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
definition[1]: to make a group of people or animals have to leave the place where they normally live
example[2]: Fifty thousand people have been displaced by the fighting.
definition[2]: to force something out of its usual place or position
example[3]: The water displaced by the landslides created a tidal wave.
